results.title: Five loaves
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Peter Sasdy, Hemisphere Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storybook International”.
Two friends have five loaves between them; one three and the other two. A stranger who shared their bread gives three pennies to one and two pennies to the other as payment. The one with two pennies is not happy but a judge resolves their argument in an enlightening manner. A Rumanian tale. Narrated by Claire Nielson.

results.title: Five Go to Smuggler's Top
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
The Five go to Smuggler’s Top to stay with the Lenoir family. It is not long before they meet the eccentric Mr Barlowe - a man who seems to be responsible for the queer and highly suspicious things that are happening in the area. The five face a mystery full of excitement in and out of the underground secret passages and on the surrounding sea marshes. Rated: G

results.title: Five go down to the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
While on a cycling holiday in Cornwall, the Five hear how in the past, pirates used to set up a light on stormy nights on the Tremannon coast to wreck ships. The children investigate the cove at night and find that there are still mysterious lights and some sinister goings-on.

results.title: Five get into trouble. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: The children are on a cycling holiday when they are joined by Richard Kent, the twelve year old son of rich parents. Two villains chase and try to capture him, but he escapes. They later kidnap Dick by mistake and take him to the gloomy and ancient manor house, Owl’s Den.

results.title: Five easy pizzas
results.creator_credit: Jo Bell, Australian Film Commission, Mark Hanlin, Garry Richards, Clayton Jacobson and Ray Boseley
results.brief_description: A collection of five Australian short comedy films, linked by a pizza delivery man having one of those days when nothing seems to go right. “Bernie’s Magic Moment”: a fanatical Collingwood football club supporter (Chris Haywood) is doing the ironing and gets carried away watching a football match; “Gran’s Big Adventure”: Bunney Brooke plays an old lady who becomes locked in a sofa and ends up having a ball of a time; “Midday Crisis”: a man training to be a private investigator discovers the wisdom in not interfering in a neighbour’s business; “Environmental”: a nerdy guy (Kym Gyngell) is terrorised by a radical greenie; “Prickly Heat”: the pizza delivery man finally loses his cool completely. A very funny and stylish collection of films.

results.title: Five bloody weeks : the Syrian Campaign June-July 1941
results.creator_credit: Les McLaren and Headquarters Training Command
results.brief_description: By June 1941, Commonwealth forces were scattered across the Mediterranean and a German airborne invasion of Syria and Iraq threatened. Winston Churchill demanded action, and so a scratch force, including the Australian Seventh Division, was brought together under the command of John Lavarack, one of Australia’s finest generals, to seize the initiative. His orders were to take Syria. Lavarack and his men would be pitted against the troops of Vichy France - once their allies on the Western Front in World War I, now their bitter enemies in this ancient land. This would be no easy campaign. This would prove to be the bloodiest five weeks of the whole war. Presented by Peter Watson.

results.title: Five billion years
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Verrall, Derek Lamb and Joyce Borenstein
results.brief_description: This superbly animated science film traces the evolution of North America from the Earth’s geophysical beginnings, through the genesis of the first living organisms, right up to the arrival of humans. Radiant colors and smooth-flowing animation evoke sizzling lava rivers, oceans bursting with life, and freezing ice ages. The film provides an excellent view of the time frame within which these remarkable events took place and highlights the fact that, relatively speaking, we are newcomers to Planet Earth. (Awards: Houston)

results.title: Five Australians: Richard Walsh
results.creator_credit: Kip Porteous, Michael Pearce and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”.
A portrait of Richard Walsh, editor of the satirical magazine OZ, discussing his views on Australian society.

results.title: Five are together again. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous Five”.
With Quentin Kirrin and his wife in quarantine for scarlet fever, the children are sent to stay with Professor Hayling and his son, Tinker. An exciting adventure begins when a circus comes to town and some ‘top secret’ notes disappear from the Professor’s study.
